lines.text: Who shall I say it's from, her lawyer?
Lawyer? Hardly.
Well if this were bad news...
Do I look like bad new?
Listen, pal, it's happened to me. Did you ever get knocked off your feet? Dizzy? Slap-happy? Hit between the eyes but you couldn't see straight?
Yeah, once. She had a boyfriend - a prizefighter. Hey, is this a dame?
Dame, Chappie? No, no. She's the most wonderful, the loveliest. I don't know, she's something out of this world! She's way up there, Chappie, like a, like a new moon in the sky.
Like a cloud, floating by.
Wait a minute, pal. Lay off. Forget it. Dames like that come out of ice boxes.
One thing is obvious, you're mad!
Oh, well, thank you.
Impertinent. Talkative. Fresh. Are you honest? I think you are.
So do I.
That's good.
How much is a secretary paid?
Well, if she's good looking...
Oh, stop it! You owe me thirty-two hundred dollars. I'm going to employ you as my secretary for ten weeks at three hundred a week. Now, the debt will be cancelled.
I can't type.
You won't have to.
Do you go to the theater?
Oh, the theater's nice... anything for a good time.
On the stage, the butler brings in a chicken. At least it looks like a chicken, it pretends to be a chicken, but, it isn't a chicken. It's made of cardboard.
What of it?
You shall be my cardboard lover.
Oh, company?
Oh, yes, Terry, darling. This is Tony Darling, Tony Barling!
I'm not her love, I'm her fate.
We women, we're all alike.
All of us. Ha-ha. We all run after our own unhappiness. If a woman's been deceived by an inventor and beaten by a Russian, the next man she'll fall in love with will be a Russian inventor.
Princess, you're a dead pigeon.
If ever again I treat you badly...
I know, I beat you.
Yes!
[Kiss]
